articles.author: Robert Barnes, Robert Barnes
articles.title: Supreme Court rules that companies can require workers to accept individual arbitration
articles.description: The decision confirms that certain contracts can keep workers from pursuing class-action lawsuits in federal court.

articles.author: Carol Morello, Carol Morello
articles.title: Pompeo vows U.S., Mideast allies will ‘crush’ Iranian operatives around the world
articles.description: In a speech to the Heritage Foundation, the U.S. secretary of state laid out a list of demands Iran must agree to before sanctions are lifted.

articles.author: https://www.nytimes.com/by/alan-rappeport
articles.title: Trump Defends Administration’s Trade Strategy With China
articles.description: The president praised his approach, and criticized Democrats, in a series of tweets on Monday following a three-day negotiation session that ended with little clarity.

articles.author: http://www.nytimes.com/by/motoko-rich
articles.title: Now Even Japan Is Pushing Back Against Trump’s Tariffs
articles.description: Japan is considering filing a complaint with the W.T.O. against the United States for tariffs on steel and aluminum imports, a sign it could be readying for a trade war.

articles.author: BBC News
articles.title: Harry and Meghan release wedding photos
articles.description: The royal newly-weds have released three official photographs from their wedding day at Windsor Castle on Saturday.

articles.author: Aaron Blake, Aaron Blake
articles.title: Analysis | Is Rod Rosenstein indulging Trump’s conspiracy theories too much?
articles.description: Rosenstein may be playing the long game and trying to buy some time. But he also risks undermining the Mueller probe.

articles.title: Hillary Clinton trolls Trump with Russian hat - CNN Video
articles.description: While speaking during Yale University's 2018 class day, Hillary Clinton took a jab at her former 2016 campaign rival, now-President Donald Trump.

articles.author: Tawnell D. Hobbs
articles.title: In Texas, Changing Talk About Guns, but Will Change Follow?
articles.description: When Texas Gov. Greg Abbott this week convenes the first of his planned roundtable discussions to come up with laws to protect people from gun violence, it could mark a turning point for the state.

articles.author: Adrienne Roberts
articles.title: Advanced Features Make Cars Safer, but They’re Slow to Catch On
articles.description: Most new cars nowadays can be outfitted with advanced safety gear, but salespeople often fail to pitch buyers on the benefits of these potentially lifesaving but costly features.

articles.author: John Wagner, John Wagner
articles.title: Trump lambastes a former CIA director ahead of installation of a new one
articles.description: On Twitter, the president quoted a harsh critic of John Brennan, who led the agency under President Barack Obama.

articles.author: https://www.nytimes.com/by/kenneth-p-vogel
articles.title: Advising Bolton is a ‘Shadow N.S.C.’
articles.description: The new national security adviser has been quietly taking advice from a few longtime associates. Some have business interests that overlap with the N.S.C.

articles.author: Nicole Gaouette and Laura Koran, CNN
articles.title: Pompeo threatens US will 'crush' Iran through sanctions and pressure campaign
articles.description: The US will aim to "crush" Iran with economic and military pressure unless it changes its behavior in the Middle East, Secretary of State Mike Pompeo said Monday.

articles.author: BBC News
articles.title: US vows strongest ever Iran sanctions
articles.description: The top US diplomat says Iran will be "battling to keep its economy alive" after sanctions take effect.

articles.author: Michael R. Gordon
articles.title: U.S. Lays Out Demands for New Iran Nuclear Deal
articles.description: The Trump administration escalated its demands on Iran, putting Tehran on notice that any new nuclear deal would require it to stop enriching all uranium and halt its support for militant groups in the region.

articles.author: John Wagner, John Wagner
articles.title: Trump warns China to stay ‘strong & tight’ on North Korea border
articles.description: The president’s tweet comes amid continuing uncertainty about whether his summit with Kim Jong Un will take place next month.

articles.author: BBC News
articles.title: China launch will prep for Moon landing
articles.description: China has launched a relay satellite to prepare for a Moon rover mission planned for later in the year.

articles.author: Josh Zumbrun
articles.title: Treasury Secretary Says U.S., China Have Suspended Tariffs
articles.description: The U.S. suspended its threat to impose tariffs on $150 billion in Chinese imports to the U.S. while negotiations with China continue, but President Donald Trump could impose the tariffs if a deal between the two countries doesn’t progress, Treasury Secretary…

articles.author: Gerald F. Seib
articles.title: An Immigration Debate Distinct From Economic Realities
articles.description: There is a good case that America’s economy has never needed immigrant labor more than it does now. The long-term demographic trends also suggest immigration can be more helpful than harmful. Yet the climate is more hostile toward immigrants and immigration t…

articles.author: BBC News
articles.title: Hawaiians warned of toxic fumes threat
articles.description: The hazardous plumes form as molten rock from the erupting Kilauea volcano hits the Pacific Ocean.

articles.author: BBC News
articles.title: Toxic mushrooms poison hundreds in Iran
articles.description: People in Iran are warned not to buy loose mushrooms after at least 800 people fall ill and 11 die.
